article.headline: George Mason 74, Ohio 65
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. -- Dre Smith and Cam Long each scored 15 points and George Mason never trailed during a 74-65 victory over Ohio on Saturday. Ryan Pearson added 13 points as five players scored in double figures for the Patriots (5-1), who won their third straight game despite seeing an early 19-point lead cut to five points on four occasions in the second half. Jerome Tillman had 22 points and 16 rebounds for Ohio (2-1), and Steven Coleman scored 14 of his 16 points inside the final 5:16, including a driving layup that pulled the Bobcats within five at 66-61. But George Mason hit nine of its last 10 free throws, with Smith making seven, to seal the win. Smith earlier hit two 3-pointers in a 14-0 run that helped the Patriots to a 30-11 lead during a first half when they shot 5-of-11 from 3-point range. They were just 1-of-8 after halftime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
